creator: wsmwk

content:
Wayne Mery said
Gridlines in a spreadsheet are a display option in the SS software, not transferable to Thunderbird.

How to solve this issue? but I found that Outlook has not this issue.
creator: andymachs

content:
With version 128 anyway, after you paste a table into a new message it seems to show it with the cells surrounded be a red dotted line of sorts.

Anyway, click somewhere in the table, then on the top menu, select Format -> Table -> Table Properties and set the Border to 2 pixels or something and apply it. Should change the table cell borders to black lines. When checking the email, I see the table with the grid lines then.

Never messed with inserting tables before so I don't know if there's a way to make it do this by default.

I was pasting from LibreOffice Calc. The table I pasted did not have any cell borders defined. If I were to have printed it from LibreOffice, no grid lines would have printed.

I then tried pasting in a table that had a border line defined under the column headers so that it would be there when printed. When I pasted that in, there was a black line shown where that cell border was defined and I saw it when I received that test email.

So, it seems to handle cells borders when pasting the same way as if the table was printed.

Hope that helps, Mark H.
creator: firefox1670

creator: andymachs

content:
re :but I found that Outlook has not this issue.

Outlook is a Microsoft product and so is Excel etc. Microsoft is not in the habit of sharing it's code with none Microsoft products. So I'm not surprised that it works in Outlook.

If you need to share Excel documents with others via email then use the best method which is attaching the excel document. That means the recipient can use the appropriate software to see the data, but please note not everyone uses Microsoft Office products, so you might want to be sure they can actually open excel documents. I use Open Office which does a reasonable job.

You can insert data by using Edit > 'Paste without formatting' That works fine if you are only inserting copied text, but since all formattingis removed it's not going to solve a 'table' display issue.

Another alterative: Create a screendump image of the data in excel sheet and save as a jpg image, then insert the image into email instead either inline or as an attachment. After all, if you are only displaying data, an image would work perfectly well. It also means anyone can easily open an image to see the information.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
This is your first posting in this forum, so I do not know who told you anything in the past. But it did not come from this forum.

That it is asking for a password and knowing the simplicity of the telstra system. (It has to be simply because they don't hire anyone with any real skills to do anything anymore) I would take a wild guess you have an antivirus program that is blocking mail.

What exactly has occurred? What does the error message you see actually say. We know only what you tell us about your setup so right now we know nothing at all about the specific of your issue, only my bias from dealing with bigpod and telstra for 40 years as a customer (They were slow but the PMG did get it done right when they did do things). I still wonder how the call numbers can have exceed those expected for about the last thirty years and no one has been sacked for their failure to get it right just once. I have managed to reduce my dependence of the big Australian provider to only a mobile service. But when you live on the first left after the back of beyond your choices for things tend to be very limited.

It is possible your settings are not correct as Bigpond accounts apparently still have different server settings to general Telstra users. So about all I can do it point you to the web page with the settings on and suggest you check them against what you have in account settings in Thunderbird.

https://www.telstra.com.au/support/email/imap-pop-smtp-mail-server-settings

David Tomlinson said
Fix your problem.

Uninstall McAfee VPN or contact them and get whatever arcane instructions are required to make their product work with email. This is not a Thunderbird issue. That may sound abrupt, but I am just communicating with you as you chose to communicate your issue.

It does not work with apple mail either https://discussions.apple.com/thread/255899100?sortBy=rank Or outlook https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/outlook_com/forum/all/outlook-will-not-send-when-connected-to-vpn/5a8a8a3f-9100-469d-a8a2-72ed3a53c0b1

Googles AI has the following to say on the topic.

McAfee's Secure VPN, like other VPNs, can sometimes cause issues with email sending and receiving due to IP address changes and potential blacklisting by email providers. To address this, you can try changing the VPN's virtual location to get a new IP address, or you can use the "Split Tunneling" feature to bypass the VPN for specific email apps. Additionally, checking your email provider's settings for any potential VPN restrictions might be helpful
creator: MattAuSupport

content: This indicates that the prefs.js file in the profile is not being allowed to be updated when closing thunderbird. it could be an antivirus, or vpn most likely. Or it could possibly be that the prefs.js file is read-only. That is, it's not the IMAP account, it's that anything you do isn't being saved at shutdown. If not sure how to access profile, do these steps: - click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open profile' - you are now in profile and can view the prefs.js file to see when last updated. If you see multiple prefs files, such as prefs-1.js, that is a further indication of the situation.
creator: davidsk

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Ein paar mehr Informationen brauchen wir schon, wenn wir dein Problem lösen sollen! Warum "inzwischen" ein neues Konto einrichten? Was war dem voraus gegangen? Ich habe die Vermutung, dass TB beim Öffnen keine Konten und Ordner mehr angezeigt hat, sondern zum "Einrichten einer bestehenden E-Mail-Adresse" aufgefordert hat (see image). Das passiert nicht selten nach Stromausfall, PC oder Thunderbird Absturz. Dabei wird die zentrale Datei prefs.js beschädigt und von TB durch eine neue jungfräuliche prefs.js ersetzt, die keine Konten-Parameter enthält. Deshalb kann TB beim Start keine Konten mehr finden und fordert zum Einrichten eines Kontos auf.

Um zu überprüfen, ob meine Diagnose stimmt, kannst du im Profilordner von TB nach einer 5 bis 10 kB großen aktuellen prefs.js Datei suchen, gleichzeitig auch nach der alten von TB in prefs-x.js umbenannten Datei, die wesentlich größer ist. Den Profilordner von TB findest du über Hilfe > Informationen zur Fehlerbehebung > Profilordner > "Ordner öffnen".... Zur Differentialdiagnose bitte ich dich, auch den in der Ordnerhierarchie höheren Ordner "Profiles" zu öffnen und einen Screenshot seines Inhalts zu machen. Ebenso einen Screenshot des Inhalts der Datei "profiles.ini", die sich im eine Etage höheren Ordner Thunderbird befindet
creator: Mapenzi
